pr_title: [risk=no][RW-4678]Followup: don't spam logs and make proper float comparisons

timeline.bodyText:
Please check if there's a library function for this. As excited as I am to see actual math for the first time in 2020, we shouldn't be doing it this way. If we keep this, we probably need to make a constant out of the tolerance.
Additionally, why are we using doubles instead of a Currency class?
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText:
good call re: library function.  I'll update.
re: Currency.  When implemented, that seemed like overkill for our application since we're not doing anything complex and we don't require financial-level precision.  I'm open to the change if we think it's justified.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: Ultimately we retrieve these values from BigQuery as doubles, so we'll never have the integer-like precision we'd really want in a Currency.
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: Let's see if we can add an audit entry for this, since it's more user-oriented than system- or application-oriented.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: The purpose of this log is to alert us to bugs in our system, rather than reflecting an actual user condition.  Does that change your judgment of audit vs log?
replies.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText:
I wrote a little utility class for this so you don't have to remember the convention. org.pmiops.workbench.utils.Comparables
If you wanted to use it here, you'd need to have a little Comparable class wrapping the fuzzyCompare method. Assuming the convention is the same. I think you'd have make a comparable FuzzyCost class to wrap Double or something though, so not a huge win.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText: There's probably a way to figure this out based on use cases. I know from geometry angle and linear tolerance are different too. This is probably OK.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.message: Decrease tolerance to catch one-cent changes
tighter tolerances exposed a bad test

timeline.bodyText: copypaste.  this test uses different thresholds.
timeline.author: jmthibault79
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -241,7 +241,7 @@ public void checkFreeTierBillingUsage_altDollarThresholds() throws MessagingExce
         .alertUserFreeTierDollarThreshold(
             eq(user), eq(threshold), eq(costOverThreshold), eq(remaining));
 
-    // check that we do not alert twice for the 75% threshold
+    // check that we do not alert twice for the 65% threshold

timeline.bodyText: this was wrong!  but close enough due to loose tolerance.  No longer.
timeline.author: jmthibault79
